setInfos.flavorText: "I apprenticed with Zartoch and worked for Kerebrus. As you can see, I found Dorath more to my liking."

name: Amoudasi's Inferno
text: React: After a melee strike or action targets Amoudasi's Inferno: Perform a +5 melee strike targeting that character.
errata:
If the Inferno's strike kills the targeting character, the action that character was performing ends immediately, but still considered performed.
The strike from the Inferno's React cannot be redirected, since the only legal target is the original targeting character.

setInfos.flavorText: "...wait, you want me?" - Zagreb Umbala

name: Steam Ram
text:
May not attack.
Spend Order: Target up to two characters within two ranks. Each must succeed with a reflex save (DC 16) or suffer a wound (Two wounds if you only targeted one character).

name: Rathra Dak
text:
Rathra Dak is a fighter and rogue and her melee strikes inflict an additional wound against spent characters.
React: After Rathra Dak performs a melee or ranged strike that killed the target: Look at the top 5 cards of any deck. Remove one of them from the game. Return the rest in any order.
errata:
May look at any player's top five cards, even the controlling player's.
Only you may see all five cards - they are not revealed.
The removed card is shown to everyone.

name: Kinnag
text: Adjacent Nothrog have +3 ATK for each wound on Kinnag.

setInfos.flavorText: "The totem lodge was devastated, the spirits slain alongside their shamans. Those responsible shall pay in blood."

name: Fo'ttr'ak'ka
text:
Your Nothrog's melee strikes may target an additional rank away while they have one or more wounds on them.
React: Once per turn, after target Nothrog suffers wounds: The target has +1 HP until end of turn.
errata: His React will give the character an additional HP before the wounds are 'on' the character and before death is checked for.

name: Squire Trevet
text: Squire Trevet may use Riposte after being targeted by melee strikes. (Instead of after the strike.)

setInfos.flavorText: "What place does Deverenia have for heroes, when a god leadeth us?"
"Secure the lines to Denska, and a knighthood is thine." - Lord Gahid Rellion

name: Shikhad
text: Spend Order: Target an opposing player's item: Destroy the item, or perform a number of +7 melee strikes equal to the rank the item is in, the opposing player decides.
errata: These melee strikes are modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects. The only thing that doesn't modify it is the character's own ATK bonus, as this is replaced by the ATK bonus on the card.

setInfos.flavorText: "Welcome them, child. They are our guests." - Fo'ttr'ak'ka

name: Mammoth's Tusks
text:
Mammoth's Tusks' melee strikes ignore AC bonuses from items.
React: Once per turn, after Mammoth's Tusks performs an Order on an action card: You may perform an additional Order after the current one.
errata: Ignores AC bonuses from all items, not just the ones equipped by the target.

name: Rhelok
text: Order: Discard a fighter action card: Perform a melee strike with base ATK equal to the Level of the discarded card. If the discarded card has Barbarian printed in its textbox, the strike inflicts an additional wound.
errata: The melee strikes is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects. The only thing that doesn't modify it is the character's own ATK bonus, as this is replaced by the ATK bonus on the card.

setInfos.flavorText: "I wish they'd lend me more than just their voices."

name: Sluagh
text: React: Before Slaugh is killed: Move one of your Siege characters forward one rank.

setInfos.flavorText: "Wonder if they'll bother making an even newer Goldenaxe? We could destroy that, too."

name: Kulhen
text: While Kulhen has a Weapon equipped, his melee strikes may target an additional rank away.

setInfos.flavorText: "I'm afraid I'm not very skilled at witty banter, but please allow me to respond."

name: Sohadze
text: Order: Discard a rogue action card: Move forward or backward one rank. If the discarded card has Scout printed in its textbox, move forward or backward up to two ranks instead.

setInfos.flavorText: "Krun respects us. He would never send us to a needless war!"

name: Huldra
text: Spend Order: Perform a +4 ranged strike, then spend any characters adjacent to Huldra.
errata: Erratum 2007/07/01: The Spend Order should read "Spend Order: Perform a +4 ranged strike, then spend any ready characters adjacent to Huldra."

setInfos.flavorText: "There is something unnatural about Fo'ttr'ak'ka. Can we trust these new soldiers?"

name: Rangok
text: Spend Order: Move an adjacent spent character forward one rank.
errata: May move stunned characters.

setInfos.flavorText: "What... what has happened here?"

name: Vaeghen
text:
Spend Order: Perform a +3 ranged strike.
While Vaegen is in your hand, your Nothrog Barbarians have the ability "Order: Reveal Vaeghen from your hand and discard a card: Perform a +2 melee strike."
errata:
You may discard Vaeghen to the action he grants.
The melee strike is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects. The only thing that doesn't modify it is the character's own ATK bonus, as this is replaced by the ATK bonus on the card.

name: Hall of Legends
text: Warlords and Heroes have +3 ATK, +3 AC, and +3 Skill.

setInfos.flavorText: "You shall know many trials before your task is at an end." - The Eternal Emperor

name: D'Ilchant Keeper
text: React: Once per turn, after a melee strike targets an adjacent character: Succeed with a Defend check (DC 20) to make the strike a Critical Failure.

setInfos.flavorText: "The skies over Deverenia are dark, the sun itself blackened by the Storm's touch." - Sir Lucian
"Mortal flesh no longer commandeth the Black Sun, Cardinal Creigh. Thou canst not refuse my support in Denska." - Ghed Mnettaor

name: Malrog's Lair
text:
Malrog's Lair has +5 Challenge Rating for each Charge on it.
When you would defeat Malrog's Lair, you may instead remove a Charge. If this removes the last Charge, you win the game.
Dragons and Monsters may not be spent to defeat Malrog's Lair.
errata: On any of the attempts to defeat the dungeon, you may defeat the dungeon and remove it from game instead of removing a Charge. To win the game, the dungeon's CR must be reached and the last Charge removed.

name: Reches' Labyrinth
text:
Reches' Labyrinth has +2 Challenge Rating for each Charge on it.
After it is defeated, each player discards their hand and draws 5 cards.
Each Warlord has the ability "React: After another player spends characters to defeat Reches' Labyrinth, spend X characters in your army: Put X Charges on Reches' Labyrinth.
errata:
When attempting to defeat a Dungeon, a player decides how many characters they will spend to defeat it, then adds up their Levels to determine if they were successful.
If opposing players want to add charges to this Dungeon, they each get one chance to do so (in Initiative order) after the acting player has spent his characters but before their Levels are compared to the Dungeon's CR.
If the CR is raised above the Levels spent to defeat it, then it is not defeated and play continues as normal.

name: Nexus of Secrets
text: All players play with their hands revealed and have +1 hand size.

setInfos.flavorText: "Stay a while. Stay forever..." - Jautya Syne

name: Xienar's Guard
text:
This is an Instructor's Set item.
While this character has more than one Instructor's Set item equipped, lower Level characters you control gain Defend +2 for each Instructor's Set item equipped to this character.
errata: Erratum 2010/05/01: Effect restricted to lower Level adjacent characters.

name: Troas' Pawn
text:
This is an Instructor's Set item.
While this character has more than one Instructor's Set item equipped, lower Level characters you control gain Powerattack +2 for each Instructor's Set item equipped to this character.
errata: Erratum 2010/05/01: Effect restricted to lower Level adjacent characters.

name: Xiathe's Touch
text:
This is an Instructor's Set item.
While this character has more than one Instructor's Set item equipped, lower Level characters you control gain Marksmanship +2 for each Instructor's Set item equipped to this character.
Spend Order: Perform a +0 ranged strike.
errata: Erratum 2010/05/01: Effect restricted to lower Level adjacent characters.

name: Xantin's Ward
text:
This is an Instructor's Set item.
While this character has more than one Instructor's Set item equipped, lower Level characters you control gain Riposte +2 for each Instructor's Set item equipped to this character.
errata: Erratum 2010/05/01: Effect restricted to lower Level adjacent characters.

name: Symbiote
text:
When you play Symbiote, choose Shield, Helm, Armor, Weapon, or Bow. Symbiote gains that trait permanently.
Symbiote gains +3 AC if it is a Shield,
+5 Skill if it is a Helm,
+1 HP if it is an Armor,
+4 ATK if it is a Weapon,
and if it is a Bow, it gives the ability "Spend Order: Perform a +7 ranged strike."
Order: Discard a card: Return Symbiote to its owner's hand.
errata: The static text on Symbiote has no effect if the item is not equipped by playing it from your hand. Which also means that if the item moves from one character to another, it retains its trait.

name: Bag of Treasures
text:
For each Charge on Bag of Treasures, this character has +1 ATK, +1 AC, +1 Skill, and +1 Level for defeating dungeons.
React: After you defeat a dungeon: Put a Charge on Bag of Treasures and draw a card.
errata: The bonuses to ATK, AC, and Skill are not only for defeating dungeons, whereas the +1 Level is.

setInfos.flavorText: "Treasure unknown. Take your pick, but work for me for a year." - Traveler

name: Gacheru
text:
Gacheru may remain spent.
Spend Order: Spend Gacheru: Target a character in play. Until Gacheru readies or leaves play, this character's melee strikes and actions may target that character as if he were one rank closer.
errata: The Spend Order does not change which rank the character is in (even for card effects), but rather how far away the other character is considered to be. It is optional and may be ignored when selecting targets.

name: Tanis Tremayne
text: React: After you win Initiative: Tanis Tremayne gains the Astral and Stormwraith traits until end of turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "Where thou goest, know that I am with thee." - The Eternal Emperor

name: Glimmering Mail
text:
Order: Once per turn: Attach a cleric action card to Glimmering Mail from your hand.
Order: Spend a Level X cleric action card attached to Glimmering Mail: Gain Medicine +X until the end of turn, or unstun target character with Level X.
errata: Actions attach to this item are not affected by Salace or Forgotten.

name: Shield of the Meek
text:
May remain spent during the ready phase.
Order: Spend Shield of the Meek and target a lower Level character in your army: The target has +1 HP until Shield of the Meek readies, stuns, or leaves play.

name: Blighted Tokens
text: Order: Spend Blighted Tokens: Target non-Ethereal character you control has -10 AC and the Astral trait until end of turn. If this character is a Cantor, he may target characters you don't control with this ability.

setInfos.flavorText: "A gift from my Grandfather, along with this piece of advice: Never get into a situation where you'll need them." - Samuel

name: Colichemarde
text:
Order: Once per turn: Attach a fighter action card to Colichemarde from your hand.
React: After a character targets a melee strike, spend a Level X fighter action card attached to Colichemarde: Gain +X ATK until end of turn, or equip Colichemarde to target character you control with Level X.
errata: Actions attach to this item are not affected by Salace or Forgotten.

name: Tranquility
text:
This character is Ethereal and may not equip Armor.
Order: Spend Tranquility: Move forward one rank.
errata: Does not cause currently equipped Armor to be destroyed, only preventing new Armor from being equipped.

setInfos.flavorText: "If they ask, we will guide them. That is all we can do." - Eleora

name: Absolver
text:
Paladins have +3 Levels for equipping Absolver.
This character's melee strikes inflict an additional wound against characters of the opposite alignment.

name: Mizgo
text: Order: Destroy Mizgo: Perform a +4 ranged strike. If the strike misses, you may put Mizgo on the top of your deck.

setInfos.flavorText: "My what... pointy... sharp... teeth..." - Jonah the Burglar

name: Devious Gauntlets
text:
Order: Once per turn: Attach a rogue action card to Devious Gauntlets from your hand.
Order: Spend a Level X rogue action card attached to Devious Gauntlets: Gain Riposte +X until the end of turn, or target spent character within one rank has -X AC until end of turn.
errata: Actions attach to this item are not affected by Salace or Forgotten.

name: Lifedrainer
text: React: After this character targets a melee strike, remove 3 characters in a discard pile from the game: The strike inflicts an additional wound.
errata: May remove cards in opposing players' and teammate's discard piles, but all three characters must come from the same discard pile.

setInfos.flavorText: "Loot from adventurers from far beyond our lands. This land is ruled by kingdoms of peaceful dragons. I am not, however, one of those." - Shadowblaze

name: Tome of Memory
text:
This character may Scribe cards in yuor discard pile as though they were in your hand.
After this character casts a spell or fails a Scribe check: Remove an action card in your discard pile from the game.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: The second paragraph should read "After this character casts a spell or fails a Scribe check: Remove that cast or Scribed spell from the game."

name: Initiate Boralis
text: React: After Initiate Boralis enters play: Your Warlord has +20 Initiative for his next Initiative roll.

setInfos.flavorText: "We see so much more now. An endless torment wracketh the defiant, and the blessed do toil forever in the Storm's name."
"Beg pardon, milady Ygraine, but perhaps you have overlooked a detail..."

name: Master's Trinkets
text:
This character has +2 AC against ranged strikes for each Charge on Master's Trinkets.
Order: Spend Master's Trinkets and remove a Charge: Perform a +7 ranged strike.

name: Howling Guard
text:
Order: Once per turn: Attach a wizard action card to Howling Guard from your hand.
Order: Spend a Level X wizard action card attached to Howling Guard: Perform a +X ranged strike, or gain +X Skill until end of turn.
errata: Actions attach to this item sre not affected by Salace or Forgotten.

name: Ogre Lord Cohort
text:
Ogre Lord Cohort is a wizard and fighter and has +1 HP for each other Cohort in play.
React: After Ogre Lord Cohort enters play: If Bruu'kaal is your Warlord, target character counts as two additional characters for determining illegal ranks until end of turn.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Dark Reserve Cohort
text:
If Tanfess-sh is your Warlord, your characters cannot be killed by card effects and opposing characters can't inflict more than one wound with melee or ranged strikes.
Order: Once per turn, move an Assassin in your army forward or backward one rank.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Destiny of the Dark Reserve
text:
Destiny of Tanfess-sh.
You may have up to 7 Cohorts in your deck and start with one in play in rank 3.
Tanfess-sh is an Assassin and has an additional strike (Base +0) when he attacks.
React: After Tanfess-sh kills an opposing character: Draw a number of cards equal to the character's Level.
Order: Once per turn, target character suffers one wound.

name: Broken Axe Cohort
text:
Broken Axe Cohort has +1 HP and +3 ATK for each Weapon equipped to him and may equip two Weapons.
Order: Once per turn, if Seneval is your Warlord, ready all Weapons in your army.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Destiny of the Broken Axe
text:
Destiny of Seneval.
Seneval has two additional strikes (Base +1) when he attacks.
You may have 7 cohorts in your deck.
Seneval begins the game with a Cohort in rank 2.
Order: Once per turn, each of your characters equips a Weapon from your collection, ignoring level requirements.

name: Ancient Oath Cohort
text:
If Sir James Reed is your Warlord, your Cohorts have +1 HP and cannot be killed by card effects.
React: After a character rolls a Critical Success or Critical Failure: Move forward or backward one rank.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Destiny of Ancient Oaths
text:
Destiny of Sir James Reed.
You may have up to 7 Cohorts in your deck.
Opposing characters lose the Astral trait.
If there is a Cohort in play, reduce to 0 all wounds inflicted on Sir James Reed.
Sir James has an additional strike (Base +4) when he attacks.
React: After one of your characters rolls a Critical Failure: Change the roll to a Critical Success.

name: Destiny of the Abyss
text:
Destiny of Crux.
You may have up to 7 Cohorts in your deck.
Your Dwarves are evil and lose the Unique trait if they have it.
Crux has two additional strikes (Base +2) when he attacks.
Order: Once per turn: Search your deck for up to two Dwarves and put them into play adjacent to Crux, even if it would create an illegal rank.

setInfos.flavorText: The Stormborn have returned, and the Deverenians see little difference between their living and their dead.
The silence within the Storm is so infinite, so deep, that one can hear the very heart of the world, pounding deep beneath the surface.

name: Raging Mind Cohort
text:
Raging Mind Cohort has +1 HP, +3 ATK, +3 AC, +2 Skill and +1 Level for each Charge on him.
React: After Raging Mind Cohort enters play, kill one of your characters: Put a Charge on Raging Mind Cohort. If SanUris is your Warlord, put Charges equal to the killed character's Level instead.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Lukkot
text:
May not perform actions other than maneuvering.
If Lukkot is not stunned, all other Nothrog in this rank have Powerattack +8.

setInfos.flavorText: "I've heard that certain religions would look upon it as Hell. Don't need tourists anyway." - Sceth Hellbringer

name: Silver Skin Cohort
text:
Order: Once per turn: If Corsis is your Warlord, ready your Warlord.
React: After Silver Skin Cohort enters play: Return a spell in your discard pile to your hand.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Gilded Tongue Cohort
text:
If Fetter is your Warlord, actions that do not produce melee strikes cannot target Gilded Tongue Cohort.
React: After Gilded Tongue Cohort enters play: Target character must succeed with a magic save (DC 5 + your Warlord's Skill) or become stunned and Gilded Tongue Cohort moves forward one rank.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Destiny of the Gilded Tongue
text:
Destiny of Fetter.
You may have up to 7 Cohorts in your deck.
Opposing characters do not unstun during the ready phase.
After starting armies are revealed, stun all opposing Level 1 characters.
You have +1 handsize for each opposing stunned character.
Order: Once per turn: Target two opposing characters that share a class. Both targets become classless permanently.

name: History's Tears Cohort
text:
React: Before your Warlord suffers wounds: If Lestan Drac is your Warlord, reduce the wounds being suffered to zero and inflict a wound on History's Tears Cohort.
Order: Once per turn, target character has Riposte +8 and may use Riposte an additional time this turn.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Destiny of History's Tears
text:
Destiny of Lestan Drac.
You may have up to 7 Cohorts in your deck.
Lestan Drac has two additional strikes (Base +6) when he attacks.
React: After a melee or ranged strike targets one of your characters, move Lestan Drac adjacent to that character: Redirect the strike to Lestan Drac even if he isn't a legal target.

name: Destiny of the Ogre Lord
text:
Destiny of Bruu'kaal.
When your characters fall forward from an illegal rank, they do not spend, stun, or take wounds.
Order: Once per turn, reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. You may put any characters into play that you legally could. Shuffle the remaining cards into your deck.

name: Ginerva of the Moon
text:
After Initiative is rolled each turn: Roll 2 d20's and place them on Ginerva of the Moon. Remove them at end of turn.
React: After a die roll, remove a d20 from Ginerva: Change the die roll to the value on the removed d20.
errata:
Erratum 2007/08/16: Her React should read "React: After a melee or ranged strike roll, remove a d20 from Ginerva: Change the die roll to the value on the removed d20."
Ginerva's static Initiative text is only triggered by rolling for Initiative during the Initiative phase.
Ginerva may not use Invoke Doom after using her react. The number she changed the die roll to was a preset value.
Ginerva may use her react after another Ginerva has reacted to change the die roll, as long as the first Ginerva did not change the roll to a '1' or '20'. In fact, she cannot change a Critical Success or Failure with her react.

name: Porthos d'Ilchant
text: React: After an opposing character kills a character adjacent to Porthos: Perform a melee strike targeting the attacking character.

name: Sir Argen Undying
text:
May start in play in rank two instead of two of your Level 2 Deverenians.
Order: Kill a Deverenian in this rank: Ready Sir Argen Undying.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The Order should read "Order: Once per turn, kill a Deverenian in this rank: Ready Sir Argen Undying."
Cannot kill himself for his Order. (Zero Effect rule)

setInfos.flavorText: "Elven witch, I have come for your head."

name: Baudwyn, Banished Poet
text: React: After an opposing character performs a melee or ranged strike: If the strike targeted Baudwyn, Banished Poet, spend a character within two ranks.
errata:
Since his react is after the strike is completed, Baudwyn needs to have survived it.
A strike that is redirected away from Baudwyn is not one that has targeted Baudwyn. The strike must target Baudwyn through resolution to trigger his react.

setInfos.flavorText: "Storm's tears! 'Twould seem thou canst take a jest no better than the Eternal Emperor!"

name: Sword-Dancer Kohn
text:
Sword-Dancer Kohn has +1 HP and +3 ATK while she has a Weapon equipped and may equip two Weapons.
Order: Spend an equipped Weapon: Gain +3 AC until end of turn, or move forward one rank.
errata: Does not gain the bonuses per Weapon. She either has a Weapon or not.

name: Taltos Rellion
text:
Taltos Rellion is a wizard and fighter and enters play as if he were one Level higher.
Spend Order: Return target item you control to its owner's hand. Put any number of item cards into play from your hand that you may legally play.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The Spend Order should read "Spend Order: Return target Shield, Steed or Weapon you control to its owner's hand: Put any number of item cards into play from your hand that you may legally play."
His Spend Order can equip the returned item to someone, including the character it was taken from.

name: Lady Drac
text:
Lady Drac has +1 Level while in play.
React: After Lady Drac performs an Order: Lady Drac Performs an additional Order after this one.
errata:
The additional Level only affects her while she is in play and does not affect where she enters play.
Her react can only be used once per Order (as usual), but can be used in response to the additional Order that the react grants. Thus, Lady Drac can perform several Orders in a row.

setInfos.flavorText: "The elven ice fell around her like frozen spears and yet she held fast, to protect me. Whatsoever her failings may be, cowardice is not one." - Princess Dashkova

name: Stonefist Gargoyle
text:
Stonefist Gargoyle is a cleric and a fighter and inflicts an additional wound with melee strikes.
Order: Spend another Gargoyle in your army within one rank: Perform a +6 melee strike.
errata: The melee strike uses the +6 ATK as a base and is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects.

setInfos.flavorText: "I am one of them, for now."

name: Nolen, King's Guardian
text:
Nolen may start in play in rank 1 instead of both of your Level 2 Dwarves.
You are considered to have an additional character in the rank behind Nolen for determining illegal ranks.
React: Once per turn, before an adjacent Dwarf suffers wounds, Nolen suffers one wound: Reduce the target's wounds by one.
errata: If his react is canceled, Nolen still suffers the wound as it is a cost.

setInfos.flavorText: "The way is sealed."

name: Quartermaster Dirge
text: React: Before Quartermaster Dirge dies: Target Dwarf is +1 Level for equipping items until the end of turn, and a different target character is -1 Level for equipping items until end of turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "No indeed, nor do I tire of killing."

name: Time Lightprophet
text:
Spend React: After a melee strike targets a Dwarf within one rank, put Time Lightprophet on top of your deck: The target has +7 AC for the strike.
React: After Time Lightprophet enters play: Target Dwarf has +3 AC until end of turn.

name: Caldor Willful
text:
Order: Spend an equipped item: Caldor has +3 Skill until end of turn.
Spend Order: Target character within two ranks must succeed with a will save (DC 9 + Caldor's Skill) or be stunned.
errata: The 'equipped item' that is spent must be equipped to Caldor.

setInfos.flavorText: "Cute trick, beastie. Lemme show you what the devourers taught me..."

name: Caleb the Shifter
text: Spend React: Once per turn, after target character targets a strike: The target must choose a different target for the strike, if possible.

setInfos.flavorText: "Lowly wizards do have their uses." - Sir Magnus
"Heed Slayer's counsel well, august Majesty. Great power comes to naught without wisdom."

name: Edge, Fiendblight
text:
While Edge, Fiendblight is adjacent to a Barbarian, he has an additional strike (Base +1) when he attacks.
Edge, Fiendblight's melee strikes have +4 ATK against evil characters and inflict an additional wound if he is adjacent to two Barbarians.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/21: The last sentence should read "While Edge, Fiendblight is adjacent to two Barbarians, his melee strikes inflict an additional wound. He has +4 ATK against evil characters."

name: Hymn of Kor
text:
Hymn of Kor enters play one rank lower for each stunned Dwarf in your army.
Spend Order: Unstun each Dwarf within one rank.

setInfos.flavorText: "The monsters never do get tired of dyin', do they?"

name: Thekem Netheryn
text: React: Once per turn, after Thekem Netheryn kills target opposing character: Remove the target from the game and put a Level 4 or lower Elf from your discard pile into play in the same location, army, and orientation as the target. The Elf permanently gains the Undead trait.
errata:
If an Elf is put into play, the React is retrieval from the discard pile.
If the Elf would enter play in Thekem's army (i.e. a stealthed character was killed), it can ignore normal rank restrictions but must not create an illegal rank.

name: Kapix the Cursed
text:
Kapix the Cursed may start in play in rank one instead of two of your Level 1 Elves.
Spend Order: If Kapix the Cursed is in rank one, return an item equipped to target character to its owner's hand if possible. The target is -2 Levels for equipping items until end of turn.
errata: May target a character that has no items equipped.

setInfos.flavorText: "Replaceable. As are we all."

name: Zelakin
text:
Zelakin is a wizard and a cleric.
Spend Order: Kill Zelakin: Inflict a wound on a Monster or Undead within one rank. If you do, remove a wound from one of your Elves.
errata:
There must be a Monster or Undead within one rank in order for the Order to be used. (Zero Effect rule)
If the wound is reduced to zero, then no wound is removed from one of your Elves. Because of this 'uncertainty', you do no have to have a wounded Elf in order to perform the action.
If you have a wounded Elf, and a wound is inflicted, then you must remove a wound.

setInfos.flavorText: "So much to learn."

name: Rafkin the Impure
text: Spend Order: Once per turn: Choose an opposing player who targets one of their characters. The target permanently gains +2 ATK and +2 AC: Ready a number of characters whose comined Level is equal to or less than the target's Level.

setInfos.flavorText: "So be it. My love."

name: Alessa
text:
Spend Order: Perform two +4 ranged strikes.
React: Once per game, after killing an opposing character with a ranged strike: Alessa gains +1 Level and +1 HP permanently.

name: Eva Farstrider
text:
Eva Farstrider is a wizard and a rogue and enters play as if one Level higher.
Order: Once per turn: Until end of turn target Elf has Marksmanship +3 and may use Marksmanship on spells.
Order: Once per turn, perform a +4 ranged strike.

name: Treyik Netheryn
text:
React: After you discard a card from your hand: Remove that card from the game.
Spend Order: Remove Treyik Netheryn from the game: Put up to 3 cards removed from the game using Treyik Netheryn's other printed ability into your hand.

setInfos.flavorText: "I still remember..."
"The first time I failed Toris Kelt, I searched for a purpose and found one with Aroch. If I fail Toris Kelt a second time, I will search for my own death."

name: Taika the Disjoined
text:
Your Warlord adds +2 Initiative.
React: After a Warlord within one rank performs an Order: Taika the Disjoined performs an Order.

setInfos.flavorText: "Order Loth once served as the imperial doctors, but what need of them hath an immortal?" - Elsabet Drac
"Thou know'st succession, Taika. While thy father is lord, thou canst ne'er be Lady Loth." - The Emperor

name: Martin Exemplar
text:
Martin Exemplar may start the game in your discard pile instead of one of your Level 2 Free Kingdoms.
While Martin Exemplar is in your discard pile, your Free Kingdoms have Marksmanship +2.

name: Xiantha, Centaur Soldier
text:
Xiantha, Centaur Soldier has +1 ATK for each rank in the opposing army to your left.
While you have 4 or more ranks in your army, Xiantha, Centaur Soldier has +2 AC and an additional strike (Base +0) when she attacks.

name: Novice Ruth
text:
Novice Ruth is a cleric and a fighter.
Adjacent characters have +1 ATK for each character in this rank.
Novice Ruth has +1 AC for each character in this rank.

setInfos.flavorText: "I would endure anything to save my family."

name: Qultan the Apprentice
text: React: After one of your other wizards casts a spell: Qultan the Apprentice performs a ranged strike with a bonus equal to the spell's Level.
errata: The ranged strike's bonus is based on the spell's printed Level, not the Level the other wizard may have cast it as (such as Face of Mirrors from an Illusionist).

setInfos.flavorText: "I know your ways, knave, do not tempt my power!"

name: Jirar Huntsman
text:
Jirar Huntsman is a fighter and a rogue and enters play as if one Level higher.
Order: Once per turn: Perform a +4 ranged strike with a bonus to the roll equal to the number of Free Kingdoms in your discard pile.

name: Patroness Kerro
text: React: After Patroness Kerro enters play: Until end of turn your characters have +1 HP while in the first rank of your army.
errata: The React affects characters that enter the front rank later that turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "Even Deverenia's darkness cannot douse all light. Gain strength from hope, but the path will not be easy."

name: Kayle, King Rowan
text: React: Once per turn, before fixing your second rank when it is illegal, remove a character in your discard pile from the game: Put an opposing Level 1 or 2 character in a discard pile into play, ready, in your first rank under your control.
errata:
The React is not retrieval since the character comes from an opponent's discard pile.
No loyalty penalty is applied as it states the character enters play ready.

name: Mourn Jackals
text:
Mourn Jackals may not equip items and when it starts in play, it starts in play in rank 4, not 2.
Order: Once per turn: Move forward exactly three ranks.
Order: Once per turn: Move backward exactly three ranks.

name: Master of the Forge
text: Opposing players' actions may not destroy items equipped to Master of the Forge or characters adjacent to him.

setInfos.flavorText: "Almost done. Xod will certainly not be disappointed! With this, I may even earn my name..."

name: Horror of the Brine
text: Ranged strikes inflict an additional wound to Horror of the Brine.

setInfos.flavorText: "What do you mean, 'That was just a young one?!'" - Jonah the Burglar

name: Ishiver Darkwell
text:
Ishiver is a cleric and a rogue and enters play as though he were one Level higher.
Order: Once per turn, target Dwarf cleric has Medicine +5 until end of turn.
Order: Once per turn, target Dwarf rogue has Stealth +5 until end of turn.
errata:
May give both bonuses to himself.
May target any Dwarf rogue/cleric with his ability.

name: Atonir Genecourt
text: React: Once per turn, after a Deverenian pays the costs of an action: If that action gives a bonus or penalty to ATK, AC, or Skill, increase the penalty or bonus by 3 until end of turn.

name: Essila, Wild Raven
text: React: Once per turn: After a melee strike targets a character in this rank: Cancel the strike. One of your characters in this rank performs a melee strike.
errata: The melee strike granted by her react has the normal rank restrictions, and does not have to target the original attacking character.

setInfos.flavorText: "For now I serve the Jackals, but in time I will be free..."

name: Stasia
text: Spend Order: Perform a melee strike targeting a character in the first rank of any army.
errata: The melee strike may target a character in your own front rank.

setInfos.flavorText: "The thrill of battle. How I enjoy watching their confusion when they can't see who is attacking them."

name: Ssithiss, Sutek King
text:
Ssithiss, Sutek King is a rogue and a fighter.
React: Once per turn, after a character targets a spell or ranged strike: Perform a melee strike targeting that character.
errata: The React can be performed regardless of whom the spell or ranged strike targets.

name: Tactician Muddflek
text: React: After one of your Nothrog is hit by a melee strike, kill that Nothrog: The character performing the strike must succeed with a magic save (DC 13) or suffer a wound.
errata:
The react kills your character after the hit is confirmed and before any wounds are inflicted.
Thus, no reacts that are triggered by inflicting a wound (eg. Claidh Mor) or killing with a melee strike (eg. Bloodthirsty, No Prisoners) may be performed.
Reacts that are triggered by hitting with a melee strike (eg. Double-Bladed Sword) may still be performed.

name: B'haya, the Fiend
text:
May begin the game in rank one instead of one Level 1 and one Level 2 Nothrog.
React: After initiative is rolled, put target character into play from your hand: Until end of turn, your opponent's characters with the same Level as the target enter play as though they were one Level higher.
errata:
The React is triggered before it is determined who won the Initiative roll. If two or more players wish to use the react, the preceding turn's Initiative winner goes first. If it is the first turn, a pre-initiative roll-off is required to see who goes first (this is a straight roll that cannot have any reacts or modifiers).
The character triggers all reacts to entering play and entering the rank as normal.

name: Calf KarTal
text:
React: After Calf KarTal kills an opposing character: Put a Charge on Calf KarTal.
Order: Once per turn, remove a Charge: Perform a melee strike.
errata:
This melee strike uses the character's first strike as a base and is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects.
May gain multiple charges a turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "Are you so sure of your truths?"

name: Nightmaster Rress
text: Spend React: After you put a character into play, that character performs a melee strike.
errata:
The strike is made by the character that has entered play and uses the character's first strike as a base and is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects.
His react may be performed when the character from B'haya the Fiend's react enters play.

setInfos.flavorText: "Did Kez send you? I'll kill him! I'll kill you all!"

name: Dev'irga
text: Order: Remove two characters in an opposing player's discard pile from the game: Perform a melee strike.
errata:
This melee strike uses the character's first strike as a base and is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects.
Both removed characters must come from a single player's discard pile.

setInfos.flavorText: "See how weak King Michael's reign is? He hires mercenaries just to have enough bodies to fill out a small legion."

name: Orazhuk of Scarab
text: Order: Once per turn, choose a character: Each opponent chooses a character other than the one you chose. Move one chosen character forward one rank and the rest backward one rank.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The Order should read "Spend Order: Once per turn, target a character: Each opponent chooses a target character other than the one you chose. You must move one target forward one rank, if possible. Move the rest backward one rank."
Orazhuk's controller decides which character moves forward and in which order the rest are moved backward.
Any character in play may be selected as a target by this action.
Choosing a character counts as targeting that character with this action, even the characters that the opposing players choose.
If no character can move forward, than all of the targets are moved backward.

setInfos.flavorText: "Left for dead, revenge shall be mine."

name: Warmistress Gurlda
text:
Warmistress Gurlda is both a cleric and a fighter and enters play as though she were 1 Level higher.
Order: Inflict a wound on Gurlda: Move forward one rank or perform a melee strike.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The Order should read "Order: Once per turn, inflict a wound on Gurlda: Move forward one rank or perform a melee strike."
This melee strike uses the character's first strike as a base and is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects.
The wound is a cost - if it is reduced or negated, the action is canceled. It would still be considered performed, however.
When in Fo'ttr'ak'ka's army, an unwounded Gurlda may use her Order while in the second rank and may target a character in an opposing first rank, as the wound is suffered before the strike is targeted (and thus will bring Fo'ttr'ak'ka's static text into effect).

name: Sister Airane
text: Spend Order: Put any number of Deverenians from your hand into play. Give target Deverenian in your first rank a bonus to AC and Skill equal to twice the number of characters put into play with this action.

name: Apprentice Ramah
text: React: Once per turn, after an opposing character targets Apprentice Ramah with a melee strike or action, kill a Deverenian in this rank: Cancel the melee strike or action. You may put a wizard spell from your discard pile into your hand.
errata:
The React counts as retrieval from the discard pile if you choose to return a spell to your hand.
Ramah can kill himself for his react, with full effect.

setInfos.flavorText: "Worms! They are but worms beneath my ambition!"

name: Fires of Fate
text: Warlords and Heroes have the ability "Order: Once per turn, target an equal or lower Level character in a discard pile and perform a Charisma check (DC 20): If successful perform an Order printed on the target. Remove a Charge from Fires of Fate. If you can't, remove Fires of Fate from the game."
errata: Each time an order on a character in the discard pile is used, it is a new instance and is not affected by Once per turn/game restriction.

name: Knights Repose
text: The first time each turn a player puts a character into play: That player may search his deck for another copy of that character and put it into play.
errata:
The retrieved character cannot enter play into an illegal rank, unless card effects would allow otherwise.
If the Dungeon comes into play after a player has put his first character into play this turn, the Dungeon's effect will not trigger for that player this turn. In other words, it is first character of the turn, not the first character after the Dungeon is in effect.
Shuffle the deck afterward.

setInfos.flavorText: "The witch... the elf... she is dead." - Sir Argen Undying

name: Cheat Death
text: React: After an opposing character kills target lower Level character, inflict a wound on this cleric: Return the target to play in the same location and orientation.
errata:
Use the Level of the character in the discard pile when determining if they are a legal target.
May not be cast if returning the character to play will create an illegal rank.
Cannot return "non-characters" such as Thrice-Fell Horrors to play, since they are not characters in the discard pile.

setInfos.flavorText: "I would die a thousand times more, for another chance to become a god." - Malrog

name: Reflect
text: Spend React: After target character inflicts wounds on one of your characters: The target must succeed with a magic save (DC 15 + this character's Skill) or the wounds are reduced by one and the target suffers a wound.
errata:
Any healing ("before suffering wounds") reacts are played before Reflect is triggered. It is played after the wounds are suffered by the character, but before death is checked for.
The number of wounds reduced and the number of wounds inflicted can be changed (by effects like the Ring of Blasting) independently of each other.

name: Pouncing Lunge
text: Spend Order: Perform a melee strike that may target an additional rank away. After the strike, if the strike hit, move the target backward one rank, and move one of your characters forward one rank.
errata:
The melee strike does not have to target the additional rank away, and may target your own characters.
The movement effect of the action does not incite the Illegal Effect rule, because it is not required. However, if you have a character that can move forward then it must be moved.

setInfos.flavorText: "Faced with monsters, humans fight without thought." - Ssithiss, Sutek King

name: Taunting Blow
text: React: After this fighter performs a melee strike: Characters in the target's army have -4 Skill, and a -2 penalty to ranged strike rolls until end of turn. If the strike killed the target, return Taunting Blow to your hand.
errata:
You may not play the same Taunting Blow card a second time in response to the same strike, if it is returned to your hand. (A single react may only be used once)
If you have two copies of Taunting Blow in your hand, you need to demonstrate this fact (to a judge at least) before playing the second.

setInfos.flavorText: "Scared of the sunlight, beastie?" - Hymn

name: Gimme That
text: Order: Target an item within three ranks: Perform an Order printed on the item as if it were equipped to this character. (Pay all costs, possibly including spending the item.)
errata:
If the action on the item spends, stuns, or readies the item, then it remains in that orientation.
If the item leaves play, it is returned to its owner's hand, deck, discard pile, etc.
Actions that put a character directly into play implicitly grant control of the character to the acting player. Thus, using Gimme That on a Figurine will grant you control of the resulting character. The same is true of using Gimme That on Binder's Staff.

setInfos.flavorText: "Such precious artifacts should be better protected." - Alessa

name: Spidersilk Trap
text: React: After target opposing character enters play: The target must succeed with a dexterity save (DC 18) or become stunned. If they were already stunned, kill the target instead.
errata: If multiple copies are played in response to a single character entering play, the first failed save will stun the character and the next failed save will kill.

setInfos.flavorText: "A candle's flame is the only way to detect it." - Forge

name: Phoenix Fire
text: Spend React: After an opposing character performs an action card: Perform a number of +0 ranged strikes equal to the action card's Level.
errata: This action is not played until after all effects of the triggering action card have been performed.

setInfos.flavorText: "Raining down hell itself is a most exhausting duty." - Apprentice Qultan

name: Lestan Drac
text: React: After a melee or ranged strike is redirected to Lestan Drac: Perform a melee strike targeting the attacking character.

setInfos.flavorText: "Hope is dangerous, your majesty. An Drac's blood liveth on, some may one day hope to challenge even you." - Cardinal Creigh
"No, you mayest not see him, Master Loth. An you still disagree, I assure you that Inquisitor Chyre would be most eager to hear your arguments."

name: Soul Siphon
text:
Necromancers have +2 Levels for performing this action.
Spend Order: Target opposing character within 2 ranks must succeed with 3 consecutive magic saves (DC 5 + this wizard's Skill). For each failed save, the target loses 1 Level permanently and a character in your army gains +1 HP permanently.
errata: The consequences of each failed save are applied when the save is failed. Thus, a Level one character will die when it fails a single save and Soul Siphon will only grant one of your characters a single HP.

name: Incite Courage
text:
While Incite Courage is in your discard pile, your characters have +1 ATK and -2 AC.
Order: Discard up to 2 cards from the top of your deck (up to 4 cards if this character is a Cantor): Until end of turn, your characters have +1 ATK for each card discarded.
errata:
The effects of multiple copies in the discard pile stack.
You must discard at least one card. (Zero Effect rule)

setInfos.flavorText: "Malrog, the cult, and Dallen all wish to poesess it, but I had the courage to steal it first." - Etal Freste

name: Taking a Stance
text:
While Taking a Stance is in your discard pile, your characters are -1 Level for equipping items and have Powerattack +4.
Order: Discard up to 2 cards from the top of your deck (up to 4 cards if this character is a Barbarian): This character has an additional strike when he attacks (Base +0) until end of turn for each character card discarded.
errata:
The effects of multiple copies in the discard pile stack.
You must discard at least one card. (Zero Effect rule)

name: Conjure Doom
text:
While Conjure Doom is in your discard pile, your characters have -1 HP and Stealth +9.
Order: Discard up to two cards from the top of your deck (up to four cards if this character is a Summoner). Put this card into play as a Level 4 Classless Monster with +8/+4/+2 ATK, 16 AC, +3 Skill, and 3 HP. It may enter play into an illegal rank, and enters play one rank lower for each action card discarded.
errata:
The effects of multiple copies in the discard pile stack.
You may discard zero cards. (Zero is always an option with "up to X" as long as the action still produces an effect).

name: Stolen Destiny
text: Spend Order: Target non-Warlord within 2 ranks must succeed with a destiny save (DC 15). If they fail, kill this character and take control of the target immediately.
errata:
Fix any illegal ranks created by the death of your character before taking control of the opposing character.
Once the opposing character comes under your control, they are no longer part of the opposing army. This may create an illegal rank.

setInfos.flavorText: "Changing thy destiny is easy. Doing so without disrupting the past is the challenge." - Dallen Stormlost

name: Paralysis Ward
text: Order: Target a character (up to two characters if it is not the first turn): If you have 5 or more characters in your discard pile, move each target backward one rank. Each target must succeed with a magic save (DC 20) or they cannot perform melee or ranged strikes until end of turn.

name: Yawning Expanse
text: Order: Target a character within 2 ranks (up to two characters if it is not the first turn): If you have 5 or more characters in your discard pile, each target has -5 Skill until end of turn. Each target must succeed with a dexterity save (DC 15) or suffer a wound.
errata: The -5 penalty to skill will be in effect for this action's save.

name: Ensnare
text: Order: Target a character within 2 ranks (up to two characters if it is not the first turn): If you have 5 or more characters in your discard pile, perform a +3 ranged strike against each target. Each target must succeed with a dexterity save (DC 19) or become spent.
errata: You may target a character within one rank, even if there are five or more characters in your discard pile. The ranged strike will work against such a target.

name: Elemental Barrage
text: Order: Target an unequipped non-Warlord character (up to two characters if it is not the first turn): If you have 5 or more characters in your discard pile, draw a card. Each target must succeed with a will save (DC 15) or return to its owner's hand.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The Order should read "Order: Target an opposing non-Warlord character with no items equipped (up to two characters if this is not the first turn): If you have 5 or more characters in your discard pile draw a card. Each target must succeed with a will save (DC 15) or return to its owner's hand."
A character cannot voluntarily fail a saving throw.

name: Sir Alain d'Ilchant
text: React: After Sir Alain enters play: Equip any number of items from your hand to him that he may legally equip.

setInfos.flavorText: "Stand proud and true, O my men, for there is no greater time than now, and no greater death than to die in our Emperor's holy name."
"Speak not to me of my wastrel cousin. Twould take two men to cast aside as much worth as he."

name: Tome of the Adept
text: React: After you equip Tome of the Adept, name a feat: Tome of the Adept gains that feat at +3.
errata: If the Tome is equipped by another character in play (using Sleight of Hand or Rraven'a, for instance), it retains the original feat chosen and triggers the react anew.

setInfos.flavorText: "I killed many for the book. They did not die well." - Apprentice Ramah

name: Ring of Piercing
text:
May start in play equipped to your Warlord.
You may not play characters from your hand normally.
Order: Kill one of your characters: Perform a melee strike.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: May only be played in Open.
The killed character can be any that you control. Fix any illegal ranks before performing the strike.
Playing characters normally refers to the order performed by the player under Raising troops in the rulebook. Any actions other than the one listed in Raising Troops may bring characters into play, such as Aroch Knights and Ring of Mending.

setInfos.flavorText: "Powerful rings for fighters, rogues, clerics, and wizards alike..."

name: Ring of Mending
text:
May start in play equipped to your Warlord.
Your other characters do not unstun during the ready phase.
Spend Order: Put any number of characters into play from your hand. Discard your hand. Until end of turn characters in your army have +1 ATK, AC, and Skill for each character put into play this way.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: May only be played in Open.
Put the characters into play one at a time, resolving any "after entering play" reacts before proceeding to the next character.
The characters cannot enter play into an illegal rank, unless card effects would allow otherwise.
Discard your hand after all characters have been played and the last character's "after entering play" reacts are resolved.

name: Ring of Guile
text:
May start in play equipped to your Warlord.
Characters within one rank have -2 ATK, AC, and Skill (Including this character).
errata: Erratum 2007/10/08: May only be played in Open.

setInfos.flavorText: "Strange that they were so easy to steal." - Alessa

name: Ring of Blasting
text:
May start in play equipped to your Warlord.
Characters in your army have -3 ATK.
Order: Remove a spell in your discard pile from the game: This wizard's spells have a +2 bonus to DC and ranged strike rolls until end of turn.
Order: Discard a spell: Your spells inflict an additional wound until end of turn.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: May only be played in Open.
The first Order's effect applies only to the spells cast by the wizard with the Ring equipped.
The second Order's effect applies to any spells cast by your characters.

name: Neus' Helm
text:
This is a Neus' Set item.
React: After this cleric performs an action that stuns target opposing character, spend an equipped Neus' Set item: Unstun a character with Level equal to or less than the target's.

name: Lunatic's Genius
text: React: Once per turn, after this character performs a melee strike that killed an opposing character: Search your deck for an item that this character can legally equip and put it into your hand. If the item was not an Artificer Set item, discard a card.
errata:
If the item was not an Artificer Set item, you are forced to discard a card but it does not have to be the item.
The react is retrieval from the deck.

name: Phantom Blades
text:
This is a Ma'rifi Set item.
Order: Once per turn: Target an opposing character within two ranks and remove a Charge: The target must succeed with a reflex save (DC 14) or become stunned. Spent targets also suffer a wound. Stunned targets instead suffer two wounds.

name: Ritual Circle
text:
This is an Anathema Set item.
Order: Once per turn, spend and stun an equipped Anathema Set item: Target an Anathema Set item in your discard pile and equip it to this character.
errata:
The Order is retrieval from the discard pile.
The character must be able to legally equip the retrieved item.

setInfos.flavorText: "...and then it shall be I that wields their power!" - Essila, the Wild Raven

name: Ishara's Tidal Mace
text: Spend Order: Target another character you control who gains a bonus to ATK, AC, and Skill equal to its Level until end of turn. Until end of turn target opposing character has a penalty to ATK, AC, and Skill equal to the bonus you gave your character.

name: Abd al-Rahiim
text: Spend React: After a melee strike targets a Deverenian in this rank: Redirect the strike or action to a character adjacent to the original target.

name: Atlas of Vision
text:
If this character is a Seer all players play with the top card of their deck revealed.
Spend Order: Name a card type: Each player reveals the top card of their deck. If it is of the named type, that player puts it into their hand.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: It has the Unique trait.
When more than one card is being drawn (during the draw phase or similar - Reches' Labyrinth), the static effect will not cause every card to be revealed before it is drawn. Drawing multiple cards at once is a single instance of card draw.
The Spend Order is retrieval and card draw, if the card is of the correct type. But only the acting character is 'performing an action to draw/retrieve a card' - the other players are being forced to do so.

name: Silverwind
text:
This character's melee strikes cannot be cancelled or redirected.
His melee strike rolls cannot be changed or re-rolled and ignore Critical Failures.
Wounds from this character's melee strikes cannot be reduced.
errata:
When an effect ignores Critical Failures, a strike that would be a Critical Failure is instead a 1 that doesn't automatically fail. Bonuses and penalties are applied normally to the 1.
Since a 1 is Odd, an Astral character will be hit with melee strikes if 1 + any bonuses is equal to or greater than the target's AC.
A character in the Lady of Mercy's army will not Critically Succeed on melee strike rolls of 17, 18, and 19 when equipped with Silverwind. The 'cannot be changed' effect is stronger than her static effect.

name: War Mace
text:
This fighter has +2 ATK for each Charge on War Mace.
React: After performing a melee strike that hit: Put a Charge on War Mace.
Order: Remove three Charges: Perform a melee strike.

name: Persecutor's Emblem
text: Order: Spend Baiting Shield: Target a ready character within one rank and make a Charisma check (DC 10 + target's Skill). If successful the target performs an attack (Spending as normal). Strikes from the attack must target this character if possible. Stun the target.
errata:
Erratum 2007/08/21: The last sentence should read "Then, if successful, stun the target.
The target is not forced to make all of the strikes from their attack. They may forgo the rest of them any time after the first strike, as usual. Any strike that they take, however, is limited to targeting the acting rogue.
If there is another similar effect active (eg. Rally to the Cause), then the target may choose between the two 'must target' targets.

name: Frozen Tears
text:
Scouts have +2 Levels for equipping this item.
React: After this character performs a ranged strike that hit, spend Frozen Tears: Perform a +2 ranged strike targeting the same target, and any characters adjacent to that target. These strikes spend instead of wound.
errata: Since the ranged strikes spend instead of wound, card effects that do additional wounds will have no effect on these ranged strikes.

name: Howling Vardog
text:
+3 Skill
Order: Suffer a wound: Put Howling Vardog into play adjacent to this character as a 1 HP character with Level, ATK, AC, and Skill equal to this character.
errata: Uses the character's current stats, not the base or printed ones.

name: Binder's Staff
text:
Necromancers have +2 Levels for equipping this item.
React: Once per game, after this wizard kills an opposing character: Attach that character to Binder's Staff.
Spend Order: Put the attached character into play ready. Before that character dies, attach him to Binder's Staff instead.
errata: The character comes into play under your control in the appropriate rank.

name: Urisk the Ugly
text:
Urisk enters play as if it were two Levels lower if the card Troll's Warren is in play.
React: After Urisk kills a character: Target character has Medicine +8 until end of turn.

name: Troll's Warren
text:
You must spend a Seer to put Troll's Warren into play.
Monsters have +2 ATK, +2 AC, and +2 Skill.
After Troll's Warren is defeated: The player that defeated it draws two cards.

name: Sedara Tansiq
text:
Sedara is a cleric and a wizard and begins play with Oblivion's Voice and Mantle of Souls equipped.
Opposing card effects may not move, stun, or kill Sedara or target her items.
Order: Kill a character: Search your collection for a character and put it into your discard pile.

name: Prewitt the Benighted
text: React: Once per turn, after one of your other Deverenians casts a spell: A character that was adjacent to a target of the spell must succeed with a magic save (DC 9 + Prewitt's Skill) or suffer one wound.

name: Mantle of Souls
text:
Seer only.
Your characters have all abilities, traits, and factions of characters in all discard piles other than Warlord, Epic, Unique, Gargoyle, Astral, and Ethereal.
You may play cards in any discard pile as though they were in your hand, but you must discard a card as an additional cost to do so.

name: Oblivion's Voice
text:
Necromancer only.
Opposing card effects may not target cards in your discard pile.
Numerals on your cards in play are increased by one.
React: Once per target per turn, before target character you control is killed: That character performs an Order.

name: Kar'rak Urartu
text:
Kar'rak Urartu is a fighter and a wizard, and his melee strikes inflict an additional wound.
Your Dragons are non-Unique Mercenaries and may enter play behind the last rank of your army.
You begin the game with a Dragon in Rank 3.
Order: Once per turn, inflict a wound on an adjacent Dragon: Ready Kar'rak. Kar'rak may perform this action while stunned.

name: Destiny of Unfinished Mercy
text:
Destiny of Ishiver Darkwell.
You may have up to 7 Cohorts in your deck.
Before one of your characters suffers wounds: Reduce the wounds by one.
Your clerics are also rogues and vice versa.
Your characters have a bonus to ATK, AC, and Skill equal to their Medicine and/or Stealth.
Order: Once per turn: Remove all wounds from target character.

name: Unfinished Mercy Cohort
text:
If Ishiver Darkwell is your Warlord, your characters have +2 HP and +4 Skill.
React: After Unfinished Mercy Cohort enters play: Target character gains Stealth +5 and Medicine +5 until end of turn.
errata: Erratum 2007/08/16: May only be played in Open.

name: Destiny of the Silver Skin
text:
Destiny of Corsis.
You may have up to 7 cohorts in your deck.
Card effects cannot prevent Corsis from performing Reacts.
Order: Once per turn: Search your deck for two cards and put them into your hand.
React: After Corsis casts a spell: Perform an additional Order after the current one.

name: Annals of Triumph
text: This character has +5 Skill and +1 HP.

setInfos.flavorText: "I just bookmark the useful pages." - Black Tom of Corinth

name: Raging Cyclops
text: Order: Once per turn, target an opposing character. Until end of turn Raging Cyclops has the ability "React: After the targeted character moves forward or backward one or more ranks: Move forward or backward one rank."

name: Sarakian Ettin
text: Sarakian Ettin gains +1 HP and has an additional melee strike (base +2 ATK) when he attacks for each player allied to you.

setInfos.flavorText: The Ettin only descend from their lairs for the greatest of battles.

name: Clarion
text:
React: Once per turn, after you roll Initiative: Ready a character in your army.
Order: Spend and destroy Clarion: Search your deck for a card named Zenith and equip it to this character spent.
errata:
Focus cannot react to allow a readied Dwarf to attack, as the readying is during the Initiative phase.
The character must meet the class and Level requirements for equipping the retrieved Item.
The Order is retrieval from the deck.

setInfos.flavorText: "These birds, they are the key... I'm sure of it!" - Kara Wadreth

name: Xaros the Mist
text:
React: After Xaros enters play: Move target Deverenian you control forward or backward one rank.
React: Once per turn, after Xaros moves target Deverenian: Succeed with a magic check (DC 18) to move the target forward or backward one rank.

name: Zenith
text:
Cleric and Fighter only.
Your characters with Daybreak have +2 ATK. If it is the first turn, they instead have +5 ATK.
Order: Spend and destroy Zenith: Search your deck for a card named Halcyon and equip it to this character spent.
errata:
The character must meet the class and Level requirements for equipping the retrieved Item.
The Order is retrieval from the deck.

name: Halcyon
text:
Cleric and Rogue only.
React: Once per turn, after you roll Initiative, stun a character in your army: Stun a non-Warlord character of equal or lower level than your character.
Order: Spend and destroy Halcyon: Search your deck for a card named Nadir and equip it to this character spent.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The React should read "React: Once per turn, after your roll Initiative, stun a ready character in your army: Stun a non-Warlord character of equal or lower Level than your character."
The character must meet the class and Level requirements for equipping the retrieved Item.
The Order is retrieval from the deck.

name: Nadir
text:
Cleric and Wizard only.
Your characters with Nightfall have +2 AC. If it is not the first turn, they also have +2 Skill.
Order: Spend and destroy Nadir: Search your deck for a card named Clarion and equip it to this character spent.
errata:
The character must meet the class and Level requirements for equipping the retrieved Item.
The Order is retrieval from the deck.

name: Embrace Death
text: Spend Order: Discard X cards: Target X+1 characters within two ranks who succeed with a magic save (DC 16) or stun. For each failure, you may remove a wound from a character in play.
errata:
You may discard 0 Cards.
The wounds are not removed until after all saves are performed.

setInfos.flavorText: "You humans think of day and night as merely periods of time..."

name: Luminous Cure
text:
Nightfall - React: Before target character suffers a wound, inflict a wound on one of your characters: If it is not the first turn, reduce the wounds on the target by one.
Spend Order: Put Luminous Cure into play in your first rank as a Level 1 cleric with +1 ATK, 13 AC, +3 Skill, 2 HP, Medicine +7, and the ability "Spend Order: Return Luminous Cure to your hand."
errata: The Spend Order creates a summoned character.

name: Sustaining Aura
text: Spend Order: Ready target lower-Level unstunned character: If this character is a Cantor, the target has +5 ATK, AC, and Skill until end of turn. If this character is a Druid, you may move the target forward or backward one rank. If this character is a Seer, the target's next die roll this turn is a Critical Success.
errata: Erratum 2007/09/14: The Spend Order should read "Spend Order: Target a spent but not stunned lower-Level character: Ready the target. If this character is a Cantor, the target has +5 ATK, AC and Skill until end of turn. If this character is a Druid, you may move the target forward or backward one rank. If this character is a Seer, the target's next die roll this turn is a Critical Success."

name: Armor of Devotion
text: Spend Order: Target a character: The next time the target suffers wounds this turn, reduce the wounds to zero. If this character is a Cantor the target gains +3 ATK and +3 AC until end of turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "Returning the Isles of Light and Shadow to our dominion wouldst prove thy loyalty to the Storm, Prioress Sophique." - The Eternal Emperor

name: Entangle
text:
Druids perform this action without spending.
Spend Order: Target an opposing character within two ranks: Until end of turn, items that give the character bonuses to ATK, AC, or Skill instead give equal penalties.
errata:
Druids may perform this action while spent.
Any item that affects the targeted character has its bonuses turned into penalties, regardless of who has it equipped.
Affected items are changed for all characters that might normally benefit from it, not just the targeted character.

name: Thrust
text: Order: Discard any number of cards: Perform a +0 melee strike. This character gains +5 ATK for this strike for each card discarded.
errata:
You may discard 0 cards.
This melee strike is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects. The only thing that doesn't modify it is the character's own ATK bonus, as this is replaced by the +0 base ATK bonus on the card.

setInfos.flavorText: "If you do not want to kill, do not fight." - Sir Robert
"...here they are the essence of being, of living, of surviving..."

name: Inner Light
text:
Nightfall - React: After performing a melee strike that killed a character: If this is not the first turn, ready an adjacent character.
Spend Order: Put Inner Light into play in your first rank as a Level 1 Fighter with +4 ATK, 10 AC, +1 Skill, 2 HP Powerattack +7 and the ability "Spend Order: Return Inner Light to your hand."
errata: The Spend Order creates a summoned character.

name: Cardinal Bromin
text: React: After Cardinal Bromin enters play: Give another Deverenian +4 ATK, +4 AC, and +4 Skill until the end of your next turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "Faith hath abandoned the Drac line, but as for all good Deverenians, Elsabet hungered for more than mere chance." - The Eternal Emperor
"The Inquisition doth besiege Order Genecourt of my father's line. Faith sustaineth me beyond age, but my blameless cousins cannot endure."

name: Ways of War
text: Order: If this character is a Ranger, perform a +7 ranged strike. If this character is a Paladin, ready up to two Steeds in your army. If this character is a Barbarian, this character's next melee strike this turn may target an additional rank away.
errata: The fighter must have a subclass to perform this action. (Zero Effect rule)

name: Refuse to Yield
text: React: After an action that does not produce melee strikes targets a character in this rank: Redirect that action to this character.
errata: The fighter must be a legal target for the action, and not already targeted by it.

setInfos.flavorText: "Didst thou think I would simply give in to you, elf? Clearly you've not fought a true knight before." - Sir Kolden Aedroud

name: Close Combat
text: Order: Move forward one rank if possible. If this character is a Barbarian, he may perform a +4 melee strike. If this character is a Paladin, until end of turn characters in the same rank as him have +3 ATK and AC. If this character is a Ranger, you may move another character in your army forward one rank.
errata:
The Paladin's bonus will follow the Paladin as he moves to other ranks, and affects himself and affects any characters that enter the rank later in the turn.
The Barbarian's melee strike is modified by items and/or any modifiers from other card effects. The only thing that doesn't modify it is the character's own ATK bonus, as this is replaced by the +4 Base ATK bonus on the card.
May be performed by a fighter in the front rank as long as one of the other three effects take place.

name: Neutralize
text: Order: Discard X cards: Inflict a wound on target character within one rank, whose Level is equal to X+1.
errata: You may discard 0 cards.

setInfos.flavorText: "...you would do well to learn..."

name: Fascinate
text:
While this card is in your discard pile, Bards may play it as if it were in your hand and then remove it from the game.
React: After an action that doesn't produce melee strike targets this character: The acting character mest succeed with a perception check (DC 8 + this rogue's Skill) or beome stunned and the action is canceled.

name: Subvert
text:
Scouts perform this action without spending.
Spend Order: Look at the top 5 cards of any deck. Discard one of those cards, and remove one of those cards from the game. Return the rest to the top of that deck.
errata:
Scouts may perform this action while spent.
Return the remaining cards in their original order - do not shuffle.
If the performing player uses this action on his own deck, it counts as retrieval from the deck.

setInfos.flavorText: "Your alliance was over before it began." - Zevil Adinerach

name: Brilliant Bound
text:
Nightfall - Order: If this isn't the first turn, move forward or backward up to two ranks.
Spend Order: Put Brilliant Bound into play in any first rank as a Level 1 Rogue with +2 ATK, 12 AC, +2 Skill, 2 HP, Stealth +7 and the ability "Spend Order: Return Brilliant Bound to your hand."
errata: The Spend Order creates a summoned character.

name: Wheels within Wheels
text: React: After this rogue targets a melee or ranged strike: If this character is an Assassin the strike inflicts an additional wound. If this character is a Bard, the target has -3 ATK, AC, and Skill until end of turn. If this character is a Scout you may retarget the strike to a character an additional rank away.
errata:
Scouts may use Marksmanship before choosing the new target of the strike.
The rogue must have a subclass to perform this action. (Zero Effect rule)

name: Evoke Crisis
text:
Ranged strikes from this spell may target an adjacent rank.
Order: Discard any number of cards: Perform a +2 ranged strike. Perform a +0 ranged strike for each card discarded.
errata:
Erratum 2007/10/08: The Order should read "Order: Discard any number of cards, up to this character's Level: Perform a +2 ranged strike. Then perform a +0 ranged strike for each card discarded."
You may discard 0 Cards.
A character that is +1 Level for playing spells/actions are treated as one level higer for the number of cards they may discard.

setInfos.flavorText: "...from the natives in that regard." - Kevrosh Dathar

name: Dazzling Aptitude
text:
Nightfall - Spend Order: If this isn't the first turn, target character counts as two additional characters for determining illegal ranks until end of turn.
Spend Order: Put Dazzling Aptitude into play in your first rank as a Level 3 wizard with +2 ATK, 10 AC, +4 Skill, 2 HP, and the ability "Spend Order: Return Dazzling Aptitude to your hand."
errata: The Spend Order creates a summoned character.

name: Corinne Drac
text: React: After Corinne enters play: Perform a decree.

setInfos.flavorText: "You know I hath no love for the Emperer. Will you stand with me, Brymin?"
"The Emperor spurns us, and the Church and Orders have followed his will. We stand alone."
"Uncle is busy, my lords. I trust you would not interrupt."

name: Curse of Broken Spire
text: Spend Order: Target character within three ranks (Two characters if the caster is an Illusionist) must succeed with a magic save (DC 8 + the caster's Skill + 5 if the caster is a Necromancer) or suffer a wound and, if the caster is a Summoner, you may search your deck for an equal or lower Level character and put it in your hand.
errata:
When cast by a Summoner, the search for the character uses the caster's Level and counts as draw and retrieval from the deck.
When cast by an Illusionist-Summoner, each of the targeted characters that fails the save allows you to search for a character.

name: Rattle the Bones
text:
Necromancers perform this action without spending.
Spend Order: Remove up to three characters in your discard pile from the game: Until end of turn your characters gain a bonus to ATK equal to twice the number of characters removed. Your Undead gain an equal bonus to AC.
errata:
Necromancers may perform this action while spent.
Does not count as retrieval from the discard pile.

name: Sir Kolden Aedroud
text:
Sir Kolden Aedroud is a fighter and a wizard and enters play as if he were one Level higher.
Paladins in this rank have +2 ATK and Riding +2.
Illusionists in this rank have the ability "React: Once per turn, after a melee or ranged strike targets this character: Redirect the strike to an adjacent character."
errata:
He benefits from both of his own effects.
His granted React is used by the Illusionist to redirect the strike from themselves to an adjacent character. That is, 'this character' becomes self-referential to the Illusionist.

name: Lord Tuathal
text:
Daybreak - If it is the first turn Lord Tuathal is a wizard and has the ability "Order: Once per turn: perform a +0 ranged strike."
Nightfall - If it is not the first turn Lord Tuathal is a fighter and has +5 ATK and +2 AC.

name: Madriga
text:
Daybreak - Order: Inflict a wound on Madriga: If it is the first turn, your characters have +3 ATK until end of turn.
Nightfall - Order: Once per turn, remove a wound from Madriga: If it is not the first turn target another Deverenian who gets +1 HP permanently.
errata: Her Nightfall Order cannot be performed if there is no other Deverenian to gain the HP. (Zero Effect rule)

name: Prioress Sophique
text:
Daybreak - React: After Sophique enters play: If it is the first turn, characters in your front rank have +5 ATK and +5 AC until end of turn.
Nightfall - React: After Sophique enters play: If is not the first turn, search your deck for a card and put it on top of your deck.
errata:
Her Daybreak React will affect characters that enter the front rank later in the turn.
Her Nightfall React counts as retrieval from the deck, and does not have to be revealed to other players. Shuffle the deck before placing the card on top.

setInfos.flavorText: "Even here the Storm doth weep for our sins."

name: Bishop Ambros
text: Order: Discard a character card: Target character in your army has a bonus to ATK, AC, and Skill equal to the number of characters in your discard pile until end of turn.
errata: The bonuses include the character discarded for the cost.

setInfos.flavorText: "'Tis by holy sanction that we reclaim this isle."

name: Acolyte Chaston
text: Daybreak - React: Once per turn, after a melee strike targets a character in your front rank: If it is the first turn, redirect the strike to a character adjacent to the target. If the new target is a Paladin, he gains +2 ATK and +2 AC until end of turn.

setInfos.flavorText: "Rejoice, for thou art blessed!"

name: Sir Francis DeGraves
text:
Daybreak - Order: Once per turn: If it is the first turn, ready an equipped Steed.
Nightfall - If it is not the first turn, Sir Francis DeGraves has a bonus to ATK equal to the Level of the highest Level Steed he has equipped.
errata: His Daybreak Order can only be used to ready a Steed that is equipped to him.

name: Theodore d'Ilchant
text:
Daybreak - After Theodore enters play: If it is the first turn, he gains +3 ATK permanently. Search your deck for a Level 5 or lower Steed and put it into your hand.
Nightfall - After Theodore enters play: If it isn't the first turn: Move him forward one rank, and give target character in your first rank +5 ATK and AC until end of turn.
errata:
His Daybreak ability counts as draw and retrieval from the deck. You must reveal the Steed to prove that it is a Steed of the appropriate Level.
His Nightfall ability will trigger if he becomes your Warlord in a Jautya Syne deck, but the +5 bonus is gone before the first turn begins.

name: Count Adrian
text: Order: Spend a Steed equipped to Count Adrian: Perform a +3 melee strike.

setInfos.flavorText: "My cousin dost worry about one thing, Elsabet."
"My cousin d'Ilchant sends his noble brethren to fight for the ruined order Aroch, and calls it honor. Tis foolishness, and nothing more."

name: Vauxgen
text: Nightfall - If it is not the first turn, other evil Deverenians in this rank have +3 ATK and +3 AC.
errata: His Nightfall ability only grants its bonuses to characters in his current rank.

setInfos.flavorText: "She was named after Deverenus' wife? Methinks these people have been separated from Deverenia too long."

name: Danielle
text:
Order: Discard a card: Target character within one rank has +3 ATK and +3 Skill until end of turn.
Nightfall - Order: Once per turn: If it is not the first turn, target character within two ranks has -1 ATK and AC for each action card in your discard pile.

name: Kalten the Bleak
text:
Kalten the Bleak has +1 Skill for each spell in your discard pile.
Order: Discard a spell: Target character within two ranks must succeed with a magic save (DC 8 + Kalten's Skill) or stun.
errata: The spell discarded for the cost of his Order adds to his skill for the Order's magic save.

setInfos.flavorText: "Deverenus didst leave something here that may be of use to thy king..."

name: Dame Olivia
text:
Dame Olivia's ranged strikes have a +2 bonus to the roll for each spell in your discard pile.
Order: Once per turn, remove a spell in your discard pile from the game: Perform a +0 ranged strike.
errata: The spell removed from the game for the cost of her Order will reduce her bonus to the Order's ranged strike.

setInfos.flavorText: "Sorcery? Surely milady doth jest."

name: Alynna the Fervent
text:
Saves from Alynna the Fervent's actions have +1 DC for each spell in your discard pile.
Order: Once per turn, remove a spell in your discard pile from the game: Target character within two ranks must make a magic save (DC 15) or be unable to perform actions until end of turn.
errata: The spell removed from the game for the cost of her Order will reduce her bonus to the Order's magic save.

name: Sidor the Avenged
text:
Daybreak - React: Before Sidor the Avenged dies: If it is the first turn, stun a character within one rank.
